content.question: Let f be the function given by f(x) = ln(x / x − 1). (a) What is the domain of f ?

frqParts.text: Let f be the function given by f(x) = ln(x / x − 1). (a) What is the domain of f ?
(b) Find the value of the derivative of f at x = −1.

(c) Write an expression for <math> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> </math>, where <math> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </math> denotes the inverse function of f .

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
